meanings.def: not in a curve or at an angle; in a straight line
examples: Keep straight on for two miles.
Can you stretch your arms out straighter?
He was too tired to walk straight.
I can't shoot straight (= accurately).
She looked me straight in the eye.

meanings.def: by a direct route; immediately
examples: Come straight home after school.
I was so tired I went straight to bed.
She went straight from college to a top job.
straight after something I'm going to the library straight after the class.
I'll come straight to the point—your work isn't good enough.

meanings.def: in or into a level or vertical position; in or into the correct position
examples: Sit up straight!
She pulled her hat straight.
Can you hang that sign straight for me?
She tidied up and put the ornaments straight.

meanings.def: honestly and directly
examples: I told him straight that I didn't like him.
Are you playing straight with me?

meanings.def: continuously without being interrupted
examples: They had been working for 16 hours straight.

meanings.def: given by somebody who is directly involved and therefore likely to be accurate
to stop being a criminal and live an honest life
to be very obvious to somebody
to be honest and not try to trick somebody
immediately; without delay
examples: I'll do it straight away.

meanings.def: if you say something straight from the shoulder, you are being very honest and direct, even if what you are saying is critical
without hesitating
examples: She asked him straight off what he thought about it all.

meanings.def: used to ask if what somebody has said is true or to emphasize that what you have said is true
examples: I saw it—straight up!

meanings.def: to think in a clear or logical way
examples: The drugs were affecting her and she couldn't think straight.

idioms.def: to think in a clear or logical way
examples: The drugs were affecting her and she couldn't think straight.

meanings.def: without a bend or curve; going in one direction only
examples: a straight road
long, straight hair (= not curly)
a boat sailing in a straight line
straight-backed chairs
Keep the car straight when you're backing out.
The road was very long and very straight.
Keep your back absolutely straight.
She had curled her naturally straight hair.
She held herself very straight.
Keep going in a dead straight line.

meanings.def: positioned in the correct way; level, vertical or parallel to something
examples: Is my tie straight?
He stepped back to make sure that the picture was straight.
Her teeth were white and perfectly straight.

meanings.def: not fitting close to the body and not curving away from the body
examples: a straight skirt

meanings.def: going directly to the correct place
examples: a straight punch to the face

meanings.def: clean and neat, with everything in the correct place
examples: It took hours to get the house straight.
I'm trying to get the house straight before the weekend.

meanings.def: honest and direct
examples: I expect a straight answer to a straight question.
straight with somebody I don't think you're being straight with me.
It's time for some straight talking.
You can trust Ben—he’s (as) straight as a die (= completely honest).
Thank you for being so honest with me.
To be frank with you, I think your son has little chance of passing the exam.
You’ll have to get used to his direct manner.
He was quite open about his reasons for leaving.
She was outspoken in her criticism of the plan.
I don’t think you’re being straight with me.
She has a reputation for blunt speaking.
a(n) honest/​frank admission of guilt.
I’m a very open person.

meanings.def: simple; involving only two clear choices
examples: It was a straight choice between taking the job and staying out of work.
(British English) The election was a straight fight between the two main parties.

meanings.def: not connected with comedy or musical theatre, but with serious theatre
one after another in a series that is not interrupted
examples: The team has had five straight wins.
I was stranded for nine straight weeks.
This was our third straight victory.
She won in straight sets.

meanings.def: not mixed with water or anything else
you can use straight to describe a person who is normal and ordinary, but who you consider boring
heterosexual
to make a situation clear; to make sure that you or somebody else understands the situation
examples: Let's get this straight—you really had no idea where he was?
Let's get this absolutely straight.

meanings.def: to give people the correct information about something in order to make it clear that what they previously believed was in fact wrong
examples: To put the record straight, I do not support that idea and never have done.
She called a press conference to set the record straight about her disappearance.
She welcomed the opportunity to set the record straight.

meanings.def: to correct somebody’s mistake; to make sure that somebody knows the correct facts when they have had the wrong idea or impression
examples: She soon set me straight about what had happened.

meanings.def: with a very straight back and looking serious and formal
examples: Her back was ramrod straight.
He stood there straight as a ramrod.

meanings.def: the honest and morally acceptable way of living
examples: His friends try to keep him on the straight and narrow.

meanings.def: if you keep a straight face, you do not laugh or smile, although you find something funny
(to get) the best grades in all your classes
examples: a straight A student
